content: eDrawings Publisher is a plugin for many major CAD software offerings, including SolidWorks, CATIA, Trimble SketchUp, AutoCAD, and Autodesk Inventor. It allows users to export 2D drawings and 3D models—such as part assemblies or mechanical systems—in compressed, read-only formats ideal for collaboration, documentation, or review.

description: An EASM file is a 3D CAD assembly file created using Dassault Systèmes eDrawings Publisher, a plugin that allows users to export models from various CAD applications. It stores multiple parts that comprise a larger assembly, such as an engine or gearbox, in the eDrawings Assembly (EASM) format, which is based on the HOOPS Stream Format (.HSF). EASM files allow users to send 3D models to others in a format that is easier to share and view than other proprietary 3D formats.

instructions: You can open EASM files with Dassault Systems eDrawings Viewer (also known simply as "eDrawings") in Windows and macOS or with the mobile versions of eDrawings in iOS and Android. eDrawings Viewer is packaged with Dassault Systemes SolidWorks, as well.
